It is characterized by its unique foliage, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in temperate forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
